item.description: Seth and Ken talk with Jason Haddix about bug bounties

item.title: Episode 10: Jimmy Mesta
item.description: Jimmy Mesta joins Seth and Ken to talk about Kubernetes and Container security.

item.title: Episode 11: David Coursy and Stefan Edwards
item.description: David Coursey and Stefan Edwards reprise their discussion with Ken and Seth

item.title: Episode 12: Justin Collins
item.description: Ken and Justin Collins join from LocoMocoSec to discuss static analyzers

item.title: Episode 13: Charles Nwatu
item.description: Charles Nwatu joins Ken and Seth

item.title: Episode 14: Karthik Gaekwad
item.description: Karthik Gaekwad joins Ken and Seth

item.title: Episode 15: Kevin Cody
item.description: Kevin Cody joins Ken and Seth to talk about mobile security testing

item.title: Episode 16: Hipster Languages
item.description: Ken and Seth talk about hipster languages and frameworks

item.title: Episode 17: Efail and CSRF
item.description: Ken and Seth talk about current news (Efail) and CSRF Tokens

item.title: Episode 18: Chris Gates
item.description: Ken and Seth are joined by Chris Gates to talk about Purple Teaming and the WeirdAAL tool

item.title: Episode 19: CFPs and More
item.description: Ken and Seth talk about current events, submitting CFPs, and more

item.title: Episode 20: Authentication and JWTs
item.description: Ken and Seth talk more about authentication, JWTs and everything that is wrong with both of them.

item.title: Episode 21: Alex Smolen
item.description: Ken and Seth are joined by Alex Smolen (@alsmola) to talk about current events, cloudtrail audit, and webauthn.

item.title: Episode 22: Jimmy Mesta
item.description: Ken and Seth are joined by Jimmy Mesta (@jimmesta) to talk about Kubernetes and container security.

item.title: Episode 23: Ken Toler
item.description: Ken and Seth are joined by Ken Toler (@relotnek) and talk security champions and security program management.

item.title: Episode 24: Jason White
item.description: Ken and Seth are joined by Jason White (@misfir3) and talk about transitioning from a developer to an application security professional.

item.title: Episode 25: Scott Piper
item.description: Ken and Seth are joined by Scott Piper (@0xdabbad00) and talk AWS Security, including https://flaws.cloud, cloud mapper, and cloud tracker projects.

item.title: Episode 26: Justin Larson
item.description: Ken and Seth are joined by Justin Larson (@Phant0mTrav3ler) and talk about building an AppSec program from scratch.

item.title: Episode 27: Jim Manico
item.description: Ken and Seth are joined by Jim Manico (@manicode) RAW, training, OWASP, code security, and all things AppSec.

item.title: Episode 28: Astha Singhal
item.description: Astha Singhal (@astha_singhal) joins Ken and Seth to talk automating application security and bug bounties.

item.title: Episode 29: Matt Tesauro
item.description: Matt Tesauro (@matt_tesauro) talks OWASP, community involvement, Defect Dojo, and the AppSec Pipeline toolbox with Ken and Seth.

item.title: Episode 30: Dave Ferguson
item.description: Dave Ferguson (@_sc0rn) talks about the futility of developer training, initial discovery of CSRF in on netflix.com, and application scanning with Ken and Seth.

item.title: Episode 31: Rob Fuller
item.description: Practical advice on submitting and writing effective findings for bug bounties and reports. Rob Fuller (@mubix) talks about his path into security, CCDC, volunteerism, NoVA Hackers and more.

item.title: Episode 32: Eric Johnson
item.description: Setup tips for starting an assessment with Burp Suite Professional. Eric Johnson (@emjohn20) talks with Ken and Seth about Roslyn, building Puma Scan, SANS, and more.

item.title: Episode 33: John Melton
item.description: Seth and Ken go over fully vetting functions during code reviews. John Melton (@_jtmelton) talks with Ken and Seth about static analysis tools, building an appsec program, open source, and more.

item.title: Episode 34: Stefan Edwards
item.description: Seth and Ken are joined last minute by Stefan Edwards (@lojikil) to talk about security unit tests, fuzzing, and all things you will need to google later on. Blockchains and secure contracts are introduced and somewhat explained.

item.title: Episode 35: Travis McPeak
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss server side request forgery and then pick Travis McPeak's (@travismcpeak) brain about AWS security, his path into security, QA testing, and Netflix cloud security tools.

item.title: Episode 36: Mike McCabe
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss cross-site scripting and input validation/output encoding findings. Later joined by Mike McCabe's (@mccabe615) talking about cloud security, building an appsec program, interviews (both for and against) and CHRISTMAS.

item.title: Episode 37: Stefan Edwards
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss security gifts for appsec peeps. Joined by Stefan Edwards (@lojikil) to talk about his origin story (Seth gets bagged on), formal verification, and a multitude of other topics.

item.title: Episode 38: Matt Konda
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss node packages and event_stream fallout. Matt Konda (@mkonda) joins to talk about OWASP, the Glue tool, Jemurai and his origin story and other topics.

item.title: Episode 39: Jerry Gamblin
item.description: Is there such a thing as breach fatigue? When have we had enough? Seth and Ken are joined by Jerry Gamblin of Kenna Security to discuss recent breaches and AWS Re:Invent.

item.title: Episode 40: Code Reviews
item.description: Seth and Ken talk through secure code reviews and assessment scoping, more on breaches, the Google congressional hearings and more.

item.title: Episode 41: Hidden File/Dir Enumeration and Will Bengtson
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss hidden file and directory enumeration. Joined by Will Bengtson to talk AWS and cloud security, including cloudtrail and trailblazer.

item.title: Episode 42: SSRF Rebinding and Segment Team (Leif Dreizler and David Scrobonia)
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss SSRF Rebinding defenses with Segment (Leif, David, and Achille). Additional topics include password complexity, password resets, and using Troy Hunt's breach database.

item.title: Episode 43: DerbyCon, pwnhead, and Keith Hoodlet
item.description: Seth and Ken are joined by Keith Hoodlet (@andMyHacks) to discuss DerbyCon, pwnhead, and application security in medical devices.

item.title: Episode 44: AppSec California, running a Bug Bounty program, and David Coursey
item.description: Seth and Ken are joined once again by David Coursey (@dacoursey) to review topics from AppSec California 2019, including building developer relationships and the OWASP ZAP HUD. Ken and Dave answer questions about the time investment required to support a Bug Bounty program. David discusses his role at Allstate.

item.title: Episode 45: Making the most of Bug Bounties, managing an AppSec program, and Sean Poris
item.description: Seth and Ken are joined by Sean Poris (@skp00) of Verizon Media to talk about making the most of a bug bounty program, Sean's path into application security from his budding time as a biologist, and strategies on managing a large application security program. Sean also talks about methods he has used for finding and developing application security engineers.

item.title: Episode 46: Fuzzing, Frameworks, Training and Daniel Miessler
item.description: Seth and Ken talk about the recent release of ClusterFuzz by Google. Joined by Daniel Miessler (@Daniel Miessler) to talk about the SecLists project, how it relates to fuzzing, training developers and his path into security.

item.title: Episode 47: Mapping Application Source Code, Mobile OWASP Top 10, Mobile Application Testing, and Kevin Cody
item.description: Seth and Ken review steps taken during a secure code review to map out an application. Joined by Kevin Cody (@kevcody) to talk mobile application testing, OWASP Mobile Top 10, what devices to use when performing these tests and how python is awesome.

item.title: Episode 48: .dev domains, Kubernetes Secrets, Threat Modeling as Code, OWASP Glue Project and Omer Levi Hevroni
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss recent events with the .dev domain and why developers should care. Omer Levi Hevroni (@omerlh) stops by to talk about the OWASP Glue Project, the Kamus project for managing Kubernetes secrets, and Threat Modeling as code. Also .Net.

item.title: Episode 49: Subdomain Takeovers, DNS SSRF, Oauth Best Practices, Top 10 Web Hacking Techniques of 2019
item.description: Seth and Ken talk through subdomain takeovers vulnerabilities at large companies and identification of DNS SSRF. Ken walks through a few oauth best practices. A look at the Portswigger list of Top 10 Web Hacking Techniques of 2018.

item.title: Episode 50: Static Analysis Tools, DevSecOps, Secure Code Training with Eric Heitzman
item.description: Seth and Ken talk about number 8 in the top web hacking techniques of 2018. Discussions on static analysis tools and approach to usidng them. Eric Heitzman joins to talk about his background, DevSecOps, secure code training and more.

item.title: Episode 51: XXE review and techniques, Assessment Reporting and Process with Jessica Ryan
item.description: Seth and Ken talk about new techniques for exploiting XXE, number 7 in the top web hacking techniques of 2018. Discussions on assessment process, including reporting, note taking and soft skills with Jessica Ryan.

item.title: Episode 52: Serialization Vulns, Managing Careers, and Hacking your Happiness with Chris Gates
item.description: Seth and Ken talk about serialization vulnerabilities, number 6 in the top web hacking techniques of 2018. Discussions on continuous integration, hacking jenkins, reading code to find vulns, maintaining your edge, career growth, and hacking your happiness with Chris Gates.

item.title: Episode 53: Building AppSec at Github with Greg Ose
item.description: Seth and Ken talk AppCache vulnerabilities and postMessage exploits from PortSwigger's Top 10 web hacking techniques of 2018. Greg Ose joins them to talk about building application security programs, developer involvement, his background, and product security at Github.

item.title: Episode 54: Recon-NG and Burp Suite v2 with Tim Tomes
item.description: Seth and Ken are joined by Tim Tomes, aka LaNMaSteR53. We discuss Tim's path into application security, his work on Recon-NG, and his analysis of Burp Suite Professional's version 2.

item.title: Episode 55: Stefan Edwards ruins Infosec - Testing Edition
item.description: Seth is joined once again by Stefan Edwards. First in the series "Lojikil ruins Infosec". Ken is at LocomocoSec in Hawaii, so Seth and Stefan (@lojikil) talk all things testing, including symbolic execution, fuzzing, and why everything is awful. Seth becomes a nihilist.

item.title: Episode 56: Learn to Code / Loco Moco Sec Recap
item.description: Seth and Ken get back together to talk about Loco Moco Sec and recent industry news. Specifically, should all security people be able to code? Is it a strict requirement? Ken gives his take on the talks from LocomocoSec and why we should all be there in 2020.

item.title: Episode 57: OWASP WIA (Women in AppSec) Committee
item.description: Seth and Ken are joined by the OWASP WIA (Women in AppSec, @owaspwia) Committee. We discuss diversity in security and how the committee and OWASP is making the community more inclusive. Topics include first security conferences, how to get involved, and more.

item.title: Episode 58: David Lindner on RASP, Mobile, IoT
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss Edge Side Include Injection. Subsequently joined by David Lindner (@golfhackerdave), the current head of AppSec at Contrast Security. David talks all about RASP, mobile and IoT security plus talk a little bit about appsec program building.

item.title: Episode 59: James Wickett on DevOps
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss Minecraft mod hacking and applying AppSec tools to the practice. Joined by James Wickett (@wickett) to talk about the history of DevOps, why software security people should learn to code, and current trends in the DevOps space.

item.title: Episode 60: Stefan Edwards, Huawei, Android Security, and Programming Languages
item.description: Seth is joined once again by Stefan Edwards to talk about current events and ruin another portion of information security. Topics include Huawei, Android Security, and Programming Languages.

item.title: Episode 61: Tanya Janca, DevSlop, Diversity, and Inclusion
item.description: Based on demand, Seth and Ken are joined by Tanya Janca (@shehackspurple) to talk about all things OWASP, travel, and experinces. Topics include OWASP DevSlop, diversity, and inclusion

item.title: Episode 62: Abdullah Munawar, Ben Pick, Global AppSec DC, and Running an OWASP Chapter
item.description: Seth and Ken welcome Abdullah Munawar and Ben Pick to the show. They discuss their path into application security, current roles, and OWASP involvement. Specifically, Abdullah and Ben talk about running the OWASP NoVA chapter and challenges in organizing the Global AppSec DC conference.

item.title: Episode 63: Julian Berton, AppSec Day, Developer Training, and Security Standards
item.description: Julian Berton joins Seth and Ken to talk about Developer Training, Security Standards and AppSec Day, a global Application Security conference in Melbourne, Australia. They also discuss the latest lodash vulnerability and Boeing's outsourcing of developers.

item.title: Episode 64: Hijacked Gems, Zoom RCE, and Marriott Fines
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss conference proposals submissions and how to stand out. Also discussions on the latest security news, including the Zoom vulnerability disclosure, European fines for Marriott, and the latest hijacked/backdoored third-party library.

item.title: Episode 65: Adam Baldwin, 3rd Party Dependencies, and Supply Chain Security
item.description: Seth and Ken are joined by Adam Baldwin (@adam_baldwin) to discuss a topic we've been talking a lot about - 3rd party dependency and supply chain security. Adam gave a talk at this year's LocoMoco Security conference where he discuss fascinating and VERY relevant topics such as "developer burnout as an attack vector" as well as providing stats such as 97% of modern node applications rely on the code of 3rd party libraries.

item.title: Episode 66: Capital One Breach, NPM, and Secure Code Reviews
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss the latest news, including the Capital One Breach, Project Zero's recent iOS vusnerability disclosures, and further malicious NPM package takeovers. Further topics include learning who to trust and security code reviews.

item.title: Episode 67: Kubernetes Security with Stefan and Bobby
item.description: Seth and Ken are joined by Stefan (@lojikil) and Bobby (@b0bbytabl3s) to talk about Kubernetes Security based on the assessment they conducted at Trail of Bits.

item.title: Episode 68: Jerry Gamblin, DEF CON 27 Recap
item.description: Jerry Gamblin (@jgamblin) joins Seth and Ken to talk about #hackersummercamp, DEF CON 27, and all things Vegas. Discussion includes NULL license plates, software bill of materials, and more.

item.title: Episode 69: Eric Ellett, Development vs. Security
item.description: Seth and Ken are joined by Eric Ellett (@EricEllett) to talk about software supply chain security. Development vs. Security and how to develop a good relationship with development instead of an antagonistic one.

item.title: Episode 70: Andrew Wilson, OWASP and Training New AppSec Resources
item.description: Andrew Wilson (@azwilsong) , a friend and partner at Bishop Fox joins Seth and Ken to discuss OWASP, running a consultancy, organizing CactusCon, and training new AppSec resources.

item.title: Episode 71: Evan Johnson, Cloudflare and Lastpass
item.description: Eric Johnson (@ejcx_), one of the first podcast guests to join Seth and Ken revisits to talk about recent industry revelations, including the Lastpass vulnerability from Google's Project Zero. Further discussions on Cloudflare Access and ranging topics including Coke's 80s lawsuit involving trade secrets.

item.title: Episode 72: Consulting Horror Stories
item.description: Seth and Ken kickoff October with a discussion of consulting horror stories, both from personal experiences and listener-provided. Additional discussions around Cloudflare's WARP.

item.title: Episode 73: Kevin Cody, CORS, and Lockpicking
item.description: Kevin Cody (@kevcody) is back with Seth and Ken to talk about his collaboration with Tim Tomes (@LaNMaSteR53) on CORS. Also discussions on lockpicking, travel tips, and a wide range of topics. Remember, CORS is a anti-security control.

item.title: Episode 74: Ernest Mueller, DevOps, Security and Cloud Computing
item.description: Ernest Mueller (@ernestmueller) joins Seth and Ken to talk about the his path into technology, operations, and security. Additional discussions on the beginnings of DevOps, Security, and Cloud Computing.

item.title: Episode 75: Brian Glas, OWASP Top 10, OWASPSAMM
item.description: Ken and Seth are back! Joined in this episode by Brian Glas, aka @infosecdad, aka Professor Glas to talk about all things OWASP Top 10 2017, the path to his involvement, and how it almost split AppSec in two. Also a discussion on OWASPSAMM vs. OpenSAMM vs. BSIMM.

item.title: Episode 76: Guy Podjarny, Snyk, AppScan, SCA
item.description: Guy Podjarny (@guypod), founder of Snyk, joins Ken and Seth to talk about Snyk, the origins of AppScan Standard, Software Composition Analysis and his origin story. A discussion of building developer focused security tools and how this can benefit security in the long run.

item.title: Episode 77: Clint Gibler, DevSecOps, TLDR; Sec
item.description: Seth and Ken are joined this week by Clint Gibler (@clintgibler) to talk about DevSecOps, what he sees in the industry as effective security, and his newsletter TLDR; Sec (https://bit.ly/tldrsec). Comments on prioritization, asset inventory, and effectively quashing bug classes.

item.title: Episode 78: Breaches, Passwords, and Chicken Fingies
item.description: Seth and Ken host Seth and Santa's Secure Workshop as a pair this week. The discussion revolves around the Hacker 1 "breach", Practical Pentest Lab's storage and sending of plaintext passwords, chicken fingie injection, and toxicity of infosec social media. May or may not be a discussion on squirrels and pigeons in cowboy hats.

item.title: Episode 79: Live from DevSecOpsDays Austin - Next up in AppSec/DevSecops
item.description: Seth and Ken host the podcast live from DevSecOpsDays Austin, with multiple guests from conference speakers. Discussions on what each guest feels is up next in AppSec and DevSecOps for the forseeable future.

item.title: Episode 80: Louis Barratt - SIRT and AppSec
item.description: Louis Barrett of the Segment SIRT team joins Seth and Ken to discuss his path into security, mentors, and SIRT. Discussions on approaching SIRT, creating a SIRT team, and how to integration AppSec into the SIRT.

item.title: Episode 81: Matias Madou - Application Security Training
item.description: Ken and Seth are joined by Matias Madou, CTO of Secure Code Warrior. Discussion of current state of application security training, static analysis tools, and just-in-time-training.

item.title: Episode 82: Kelley Robinson - MFA, SHAKEN, STIR
item.description: Kelley Robinson (@kelleyrobinson), Security Advocate at Twilio/Authy joins Seth and Ken to talk about multifactor authentication, her path into security, and advances in voice security (SHAKEN/STIR).

item.title: Episode 83: Ron Perris - NPM, Developer Training, React
item.description: Ron Perris (@ronperris), Software Security Engineer from npm, Inc. joins Seth and Ken to talk about module security, developer interactions, and recent node security issues. DOM Clobbering.

item.title: Episode 84: Tinfoil Hat Tuesday - Backdoors, Application Libraries, Equifax
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss the latest security news, including CIA Backdoors in the Crypto AG products, FBI release of wanted Chinese nationals related to the Equifax breach, protecting applications against nation state actors, and securing open source libraries.

item.title: Episode 85: David Lindner - Voting Apps, Bug Bounties, IAST/RASP/WAF
item.description: David Lindner (@golfhackerdave) joins Seth and Ken discuss the voting applications, including the Iowa debacle and the Voatz application. Ranting on bug bounties and response times for researcher findings. An explanation of IAST, RASP, and WAFs.

item.title: Episode 86: Rohan Johsi - QA Security Testing, Security Champions, Paypal Vulnerabilities
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss bug bounties and a recent article on Paypal issues. Joined by Rohan Joshi to discuss building an application security program, QA security testing, and security champions.

item.title: Episode 87: Abhay Bhargav - Threat Modeling, DevSecOps, Microservices
item.description: Abhay Bhargav, founder of We45, joins Seth and Ken in a discussion on threat modeling in an agile development methodology, the rise and role of DevSecOps, and security within microservices.

item.title: Episode 88: Kevin Johnson - Secure Ideas, Star Wars, Passing it On
item.description: Kevin Johnson of Secure Idea joins Seth and Ken in a discussion on his path into security, Star Wars (yes, really), and giving back to the community. This includes passing on teaching, sharing knowledge, and mentoring those that ask for it.

item.title: Episode 89: Kat Sweet - Incident Response, DevOps and Developer Training, Breaking into Security
item.description: Kat Sweet (@TheSweetKat) continues our discussion from DevSecOps Days Austin. Topics include incident response, staying right while you push left, developer training, and getting into information security.

item.title: Episode 90: Voatz, HackerOne, Bug Bounties, GraphQL, Shodan Network Trends
item.description: Seth and Ken provide their take on the Voatz mobile app dismissal from HackerOne. Additional discussion of network trends during social distancing and COVID-19 as reported by Shodan. Finally some thoughts on the new OWASP Firmware Testing Guide and InQL, a GraphQL Burp Suite Pro plugin.

item.title: Episode 91: Stefan Edwards - More Voatz, Zoom, Code Reviews, Report Writing, Threat Models, and Risk Assessments
item.description: LOJI IS BACK! Stefan joins Seth and Ken to talk about his work on Trail of Bits assessment of the Voatz mobile application, share thoughts on Zoom, and discuss the assessment process. Discussions on report writing, risk assessments, threat modeling, and other appsec goodness.

item.title: Episode 92: Working from Home, Skreen, Evolution of AppSec
item.description: Seth struggles with internet access during a discussion with Ken on working from home, employee surveillance, and Sneek. Additional thoughts on the evolution of application security and penetration testing since the beginning of our careers.

item.title: Episode 93: Huntr Dev - Securing Open Source Software
item.description: Seth and Ken are joined by the Huntr Dev team to talk about securing open source software, bug bounties, and writing secure code.

item.title: Episode 94: Bug Bounty, Microservices vs. Monoliths, and CVE Fatigue
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss tips for running a bug bounty program, risk of webhooks, Segment's move to and from microservices, and having CVE Fatigue.

item.title: Episode 95: Jessica Rozhin (@JessicaRozhin) and Lady Christina Liu (cliuthulu) - Incident Response, Lockpicking, Building an Infosec Culture
item.description: Jessica Rozhin (@JessicaRozhin) and Lady Christina Liu (@cliuthulu) join Seth and Ken to talk about alternate routes into security, including accounting and joining a circus. Discussions on forensics, incident response, and how lock picking can help build an infosec culture.

item.title: Episode 96: Fuzzing and Static Analysis Tools
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss fuzzing techniques, recommendations, and experience. Stories of fuzzing in production. How static analysis tools have changed and where they fit.

item.title: Episode 97: Stefan Edwards and Brian Glas - Threat Modeling
item.description: Stefan (@lojikil) and Brian (@infosecdad) are back to talk about threat modeling with Seth and Ken. Discussion covers risk assessment, threat modeling, asset inventory, and software maturity.

item.title: Episode 98: Bug Bounty Programs, Work when World is Crazy
item.description: Seth and Ken go full rant mode about bug bounties and trying to work while the world goes insane.

item.title: Episode 99: Contact Tracing, GnuTLS, Breaches
item.description: Seth and Ken are back to security and technology this week. Discussions about contact tracing applications, privacy and freedom vs. security, the GnuTLS CVE, and possible Honda breach.

item.title: Episode 100: Virtual Conferences, Bots, DDoS, Ebay
item.description: Seth and Ken break the 100 episode barrier by talking about virtual conferences. Discussions about bots, distributed denial of service attacks, and Ebay stalking of a newsletter.

item.title: Episode 101: Mike McCabe, Ken Toler, Cloud Security
item.description: Seth and Ken are joined by Mike McCabe (@mccabe615) and Ken Toler (@relotnek) to break down their talk on Cloud Security. Discussions revolves around cloud security, but touches legacy systems, application inventory, virtual conferences, and more.

item.title: Episode 102: Popular Programming Languages, TikTok, OWASP
item.description: Seth and Ken talk about the popularity of various programming languages, TikTok app issues, and new changes at OWASP.

item.title: Episode 103: Secrets Management, Oded Hareven, and akeyless.io
item.description: Oded Hareven from AKEYLESS joins Seth and Ken to discuss the idea behind AKEYLESS as well as give us a chance to learn a little bit more about Oded.

item.title: Episode 104: Leif Dreizler - Authentication and SCIM
item.description: Leif Drezler joins Seth and Ken to talk about recent projects, including authentication, SCIM, and how to embed within a development team.

item.title: Episode 105: Laura Migus - Diversity and Inclusion
item.description: Seth and Ken chat with Laura Migus who is an expert in the realm of Diversity and Inclusion to learn more about the topic and how to support diversity and inclusion efforts.

item.title: Episode 106: Justin Massey - Logging and Monitoring
item.description: Justin Massey from Data Dog joins us to talk Application Logging.

item.title: Episode 107: Markus Schirp - Ruby and Dynamic Languages
item.description: Markus Schirp (@_m_b_j_) joins Seth and Ken to talk about Ruby and other dynamic languages. Mutation testing, TDD weaknesses, and meta programming.

item.title: Episode 108: Sean Poris - Bug Bounties and H1-2010
item.description: Sean Poris (@skp00) joins Absolute AppSec to talk about The Paranoids virtual bug bounty hacking event H1-2010, staying sane, managing a virtual team, and advice for running a bug bounty program.

item.title: Episode 109: Threat Modeling, Social Media, Imposter Syndrome
item.description: We are back with a Seth and Ken only episode to talk about the evolution of threat modeling, the documentary "The Social Dilemma", mental health, and imposter syndrome.

item.title: Episode 110: Reserved Words, Authentication, Developer Patterns
item.description: Back at it like a phrack addict to talk reserved words, authentication flaws in apps and Grindr, and recognizing insecure patterns during development.

item.title: Episode 111: Bug Bounties, Detection as Code
item.description: Seth and Ken dig into strange requests when running bug bounty programs, recent revelations on Apple security research, and detection as code.

item.title: Episode 112: Mark Feferman - Static Analysis Tools
item.description: Mark Feferman (@mfeferman) joins Seth and Ken to throw down about automated static analysis tools. Discussion of applictaion security talent (or lack thereof) and 'shifting left'.

item.title: Episode 113: Jacob Salassi - Modeling Threats, Risk Assessment
item.description: Jacob Salassi (@JacobSalassi) joins us to discuss his developer-driven, standardized, threat modeling process. Also discussions on developer empathy, risk assessment, and other topics.

item.title: Episode 114: Account Enumeration, Github Actions
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss account enumeration vulnerabilities and open source tools that take advantage of them. Discussion about the recent Github Actions vulnerability.

item.title: Episode 115: Clint Gibler - Static Analysis with Semgrep
item.description: Clint Gibler (@clintgibler) joins Seth and Ken to talk about Static Analysis with Semgrep. Demonstrations of writing rules within Semgrep and how to use it.

item.title: Episode 116: Lewis Ardern and Pwnfunction - Client-Side JavaScript Security
item.description: Lewis Ardern (@LewisArdern) and Pwnfunction (@pwnfunction) join Seth and Ken to talk client-side JavaScript security and their recent Vue JS blog post. https://portswigger.net/research/evading-defences-using-vuejs-script-gadgets

item.title: Episode 117: Solarwinds, Timing Attacks, Threat Dragon
item.description: The dynamic duo is back for their last podcast of 2020!

item.title: Episode 118: Parler, Twitter, and IDOR
item.description: Seth and Ken return with a discussion about application security in the news, including relevance to the Parler "backups". Also discussions about Twitter and latest political developments and how they affect the security industry.

item.title: Episode 119: Bugtraq, Web Cache Poisoning, and Blind SSRF
item.description: Seth and Ken wax nostalgic about the old days due to the shut down of the Bugtraq Mailing List (RIP old friend). Further discussions on web cache poisoning and blind server-side request forgery (SSRF) exploits.

item.title: Episode 120: OWASP Top 10 2021, Researcher Attacks, Parler, Phishing
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss the proposed 2021 OWASP Top 10 Risks, North Korean attacks against security researchers, password managers, latest in Parler de-platforming, and phishing possibilities.

item.title: Episode 121: Stefan Edwards (@lojikil) - Formal Specification, Fuzzing, LangSec
item.description: Stefan Edwards (@lojikil) once again joins Seth and Ken to talk all things LangSec (language security). Discussion ranges from manual vs. automated testing to fuzzing to semantic analysis to formal specification.

item.title: Episode 122: Brian Glas (@infosecdad) - OWASP Top 10 2021
item.description: Seth and Ken welcome back Professor Brian Glas (@infosecdad) to dispel the recent OWASP Top 10 2021 speculation and rumor. We talk through the origins and purpose of the OWASP Top 10 as well as the 2021 call for data and upcoming release.

item.title: Episode 123: Client-Side Controls, Dependency Confusion
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss client-side controls and 3rd-party JavaScript security features. Confused deputy vulnerabilities (dependency confusion) in the news.

item.title: Episode 124: 2020 Top 10 Web Hacking Techniques, Development vs. Security
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss Portswigger's Top 10 Web Hacking Techniques of 2020, specifically injection attacks through images in PDFs and reverse proxies. Further discussion on creativity in development and how that affects and limits security.

item.title: Episode 125: Interviews, SQLi, Concurrency, Wordpress
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss interviewing techniques for technical resources, SQL injection in the media and Github's recent concurrency vulnerability. Also a discussion on recent WordPress plugin vulnerabilities and why they are always so devastating.

item.title: Episode 126: Junior AppSec Positions, Phishing Site Detection, Client-side JavaScript
item.description: Seth and Ken are back on another Taco Tuesday to talk through getting into application security and how to support those new to the field. Also a discussion on phishing sites that detect VMs and other tools to bypass detection and observed client-side JavaScript attacks.

item.title: Episode 127: Regexes, WAFs, Secondary Contexts
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss the role of regular expressions in routing of web application requests. Discussion covers basics of routing, exploitation of secondary contexts, and bypassing of web application firewalls.

item.title: Episode 128: Stefan Edwards/David Coursey - PHP, Backdoors, and AppSec Nihilism
item.description: Seth hosts Stefan Edwards (@lojikil) and David Coursey (@dacoursey) discussing PHP's recent backdoor, probable fixes including code commit signing and the move to GitHub. THe discussion covers ease of security, developer tendencies when securing code, and application security nihilism.

item.title: Episode 129: Rey Bango - JQuery, Developer Relations, Security Education
item.description: Rey Bango (@reybango) from Veracode joins Seth and Ken to talk about his path into security. Topics include JavaScript, JQuery, building relationships between security and relations, and how to educate the next generation of developers in security.

item.title: Episode 130: Facebook 'Breach', Data Privacy
item.description: Ken and Seth break down the Facebook 'Breach', aka data collection and different views on dealing with that data. The discussion continues with privacy data and how far we should trust any social media application.

item.title: Episode 131: Jeevan Singh - Threat Modeling
item.description: Jeevan Singh from Segment joins Seth and Ken to discuss the recently-released, open source threat modeling training material.

item.title: Episode 132: Supply Chain Attacks, What I Wish I Knew Starting in Security
item.description: Ken and Seth are the dynamic duo revealing what they wish they knew starting in security and as a penetration tester. Also a discussion about supply chain attacks and a tribute to the late Dan Kaminski.
